text:
Arcs drawn with drawArc or fillArc with negative angles are being rendered
incorrectly.  They look like the inverse arc (but curving inward).  For example,
drawArc(0, 0, 100, 100, -270, 0) produces an arc which curves inward in the
upper-right quadrant.  It should produce an arc which goes around everything put
the upper-right qaudrant.

I will attach the test file and SVG it produces.
creator: ianburrell@gmail.com

text:
Created attachment 18911
Java source for test.
creator: ianburrell@gmail.com
ianburrell@gmail.com
text:
Created attachment 18912
SVG file produced from test

I believe this bug was fixed shortly after Batik 1.6 was released.
You should try the SVN version of Batik (trunk or branches/svg11).
creator: deweese@apache.org
ianburrell@gmail.com
text:
I tried Batik SVN trunk and it does not have the bug.

What is the plan for a release?  Batik 1.6 is pretty old.  Are there any plans
for a release from the svg11 branch?  Or a new release from trunk?
